member.name: M:BlazorDateRangePicker.ReflectionExtensions.CopyProperties``2(``0,``1)
member.summary: Extension for 'Object' that copies the properties to a destination object. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/930433/apply-properties-values-from-one-object-to-another-of-the-same-type-automaticall

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.Id
member.summary: Guid for container id used for JSInterop

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.ParentId
member.summary: Guid for parent id used for JSInterop

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.Config
member.summary: Attach a named properties config object to this instance of datepicker

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.Attributes
member.summary: All unmatched parameters will be passed to parent element

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.Ranges
member.summary: Set predefined date ranges the user can select from. Each RangeItem.Name is the label for the range, and its Start and End value representing the bounds of the range.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.AutoApply
member.summary: Hide the apply and cancel buttons, and automatically apply a new date range as soon as two dates are clicked.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.SingleDatePicker
member.summary: Show only a single calendar to choose one date, instead of a range picker with two calendars. The start and end dates provided to your callback will be the same single date chosen.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.ShowOnlyOneCalendar
member.summary: Show only one calendar in the picker instead of two calendars.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.AlwaysShowCalendars
member.summary: Normally, if you use the ranges option to specify pre-defined date ranges, calendars for choosing a custom date range are not shown until the user clicks "Custom Range". When this option is set to true, the calendars for choosing a custom date range are always shown instead.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.ButtonClasses
member.summary: CSS class names that will be added to both the apply and cancel buttons.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.ApplyButtonClasses
member.summary: CSS class names that will be added only to the apply button.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.CancelButtonClasses
member.summary: CSS class names that will be added only to the cancel button.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.StartDate
member.summary: The beginning date of the initially selected date range.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.EndDate
member.summary: The end date of the initially selected date range

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.DateFormat
member.summary: Specify the format string to display dates, default is Culture.DateTimeFormat.ShortDatePattern

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.ShowWeekNumbers
member.summary: Show localized week numbers at the start of each week on the calendars.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.ShowISOWeekNumbers
member.summary: Show ISO week numbers at the start of each week on the calendars.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.LinkedCalendars
member.summary: When enabled, the two calendars displayed will always be for two sequential months (i.e. January and February), and both will be advanced when clicking the left or right arrows above the calendars. When disabled, the two calendars can be individually advanced and display any month/year.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.ShowDropdowns
member.summary: Show year and month select boxes above calendars to jump to a specific month and year.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.ShowCustomRangeLabel
member.summary: Displays "Custom Range" at the end of the list of predefined ranges, when the ranges option is used. This option will be highlighted whenever the current date range selection does not match one of the predefined ranges. Clicking it will display the calendars to select a new range.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.Culture
member.summary: Specify the culture to display dates and text in. Default is CultureInfo.CurrentCulture.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.WeekAbbreviation
member.summary: The text to display on the Week number heading

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: The day of the week to start from

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.MinDate
member.summary: The earliest date that can be selected, inclusive. A value of null indicates that there is no minimum date.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.MaxDate
member.summary: The latest date that can be selected, inclusive. A value of null indicates that there is no maximum date.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.MaxSpan
member.summary: The maximum TimeSpan between the selected start and end dates. A value of null indicates that there is no limit.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.Visible
member.summary: Picker popup visibility. Use Open() instead.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.CloseOnOutsideClick
member.summary: Whether the picker should close on outside click

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.AutoAdjustCalendars
member.summary: Whether the picker should pick months based on selected range

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.Opens
member.summary: Whether the picker appears aligned to the left, to the right, or centered under the HTML element it's attached to.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.Drops
member.summary: Whether the picker appears below (default) or above the HTML element it's attached to.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.DaysEnabledFunction
member.summary: A function that is passed each date in the two calendars before they are displayed, and may return true or false to indicate whether that date should be available for selection or not.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.CustomDateClass
member.summary: String of CSS class name to apply to that custom date's calendar cell

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.CustomDateFunction
member.summary: A function that is passed each date in the two calendars before they are displayed, and may return a string or array of CSS class names to apply to that date's calendar cell.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.OnRangeSelect
member.summary: Triggered when the apply button is clicked, or when a predefined range is clicked

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.OnOpened
member.summary: An event that is invoked when the DatePicker is opened.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.OnClosed
member.summary: An event that is invoked when the DatePicker is closed.

member.name: P:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.OnCancel
member.summary: An event that is invoked on backdrop click (false) or cancel button click (true).

member.name: M:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.Open
member.summary: Show picker popup

member.name: M:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.Toggle
member.summary: Toggle picker popup state

member.name: M:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.Close
member.summary: Close picker popup

member.name: M:BlazorDateRangePicker.DatePickerComponentBase.InvokeClickOutside
member.summary: JSInvokable callback to handle outside click
